title: Impossible to edit comments on Facebook
content:
Hello,

Here is my issue : Impossible to paste a text in an edited comment on Facebook.

How it happens : 1) I copy a text on a website, notepad, ... 2) I click on the edit button on Facebook to edit my comment 3) I paste the text in the box 4) The text is pasted but i can't edit it, the comment is "freeze" and if i click on the submit arrow, the entire post disappears. 5) I reload the page, my old comment is still there

I've launched Firefox in safe mode with all modules disabled but the problem is still there.

Info : OS : Win10 Home (version : 20H2) Firefox : 84.0 (64 bits)

Can you help me ?
creator: mathieu.boscariol

title: How do I disable Firefox showing usernames in login boxes? (not the PW autofill)
content:
When login credentials for a site are stored, firefox shows the associated usernames as drop-down in the edit field of a site login.

Since this shows *all* accounts that it knows for that site, I'd like to turn that off. I'd like to keep the auto-fill of passwords, once I've manually entered the username (as it was in the past).

I've only found how to deactivate the whole auto-fill for both: username and passwords.

Any way to get the old (=more discrete) behavior back?


Thanks!
creator: P_the_B

title: Firefox.exe pysäyttää Win 8 näyttölaitteiston
content: Hei! Ihmettelin tässä kun läppärin näyttö toimii takkuillen esim. lehteälukiessa -nykii koko ajan sivua liuttaessa... Tuli virheilmoitus "Näytönohjain yhteys katkesi ja palasi" tämä toistui 3-4 kertaa ja sitten ilmoitus "Intel Graphics Accelerator Drivers for Windows 8" Näyttölaitteiston käyttö estetty firefox.exe???? Kun vaihdan Cromeen, niin ongelmaa ei ole??? Ongelma alkoi viime firefox päivityksen jälkeen Terv Ismo
creator: sixcats

title: Play FTP videos over firefox
content:
Back in the days a year ago I was able to log into my FTP server from WAN adress and instantly play any .mp4 / .mkv videos - it worked as a stream play. Now I am forced to download a whole video first and then it plays in flashplayer in Firefox. Any ideas and solutions how to avoid this downloading and play videos straight from FTP as a streaming ?

Now using VLC where I put generated access link given by path from /index FTP. Videos play instatly ony if I put LOCAL adress in same LAN , then it doesn't download and open as a stream.

Im loging in as ftp://XXX-XXX.net/

Thank You for support, IROA
creator: mara.kn

title: Tabs gone after a restart
content:
Hi group, over the years I encounterd sevaral times that my tabs were gone after a restart Since (I guess) version 60 this has not happened again so I thought it was fixed, untill today

By accident I closed Firefox, and after it had restarted all my tabs were gone, despite the fact that I have "restore previous" set in my preferences

I would like to hear If there is a way to save these tabs outside FF and how to do that

TIA Spikebyt from the Netherlands in Europe

title: Version 84.0 printing this page issue
content:
Just before updating to 84.0, whenever I wanted to right-click, print this page, I got "1" suggested into the page range form.

Now is not available anymore, so I have to manually write "1" every time I have to print only this page. How to fix this settings? Or is it a bug I should report?

Thanks
creator: Dario_

title: How firefox handle a domain with multiplied IP address ?
content: hello dear here is my senario: a web site with www.test.com domain have multiple A record that reference to multiple web server A record 1.1.1.1 A record 2.2.2.2 A record 3.3.3.3 a DNS serve give all 3 record to client without any modifing. what happen if server 1.1.1.1 goes down ? does FIREFOX browser any mechanism that automatically retry Second or third DNS record ? thanks soheil
creator: soheil.amiri

title: Mozilla service idea
content:
Hi Mozilla, I write this message here since I can't find a good place to contact you (bugzilla.mozilla.org maybe?)

Anyway, I'm a huge fan of everything you do and how you do it, and I don't hesitate from time to time to donate to the foundation.

I'm aware that most of your products and services are free, and therefore you need more resources than only donation.

The reason why I send this message, it's because I think you could add a new (paid) service to your list. A reliable and robust MX mail server system, that we could rent each month.

I'm actually renting 2 Cloud VPS, and my biggest issue was to have a trustable mail server that would not look suspicious for spam filters (spam assassin, Google etc).

That's the only reason why I pay a Google Suite every month.. to have a reliable and solid @mydomain email, and be sure my emails will be delivered every time. But I would totally prefer to give you this money better than them.

I know there's other solutions already, but I think it make sense for Mozilla to have this service, since emails and mail servers are very sensitive regarding privacy, personal data etc. and we all trust you more than Google empire.

I don't know if you can read this, but please tell me if there's a better place to send this message.

Thank you very much, Long life to Mozilla, all the best,

Phil
creator: phlppe.boehm

title: How to move within frames on a page in Firefox Mac
content:
Keyboard shortcuts - Perform common Firefox tasks quickly when filtered for Firefox 84 and Mac reads that to move from one frame within a page to another you press F6. However, when I am on a page that has frames and I press F6, the cursor moves to the location bar. How do I change the focus from one frame to another?

I checked my system preferences for Keyboard (Apple > System Preferences > Keyboard > Shortcuts and checked all the items and I have no shortcut set to F6, so it appears that F6 would be using Firefox's settings for that shortcut.
creator: CharlesBelov

title: Seeking a Keyboard Shortcut
content: I am totally blind, and quite often websites displays a question something like, "Website X would like to access your location. Allow?" My issue is that I cannot find a keyboard-only method to answer that pop-up. Most of the time, I cannot find the "click" control to say either "allow" or "don't allow." I hope that there is a way that I can respond to those pop-ups without sighted assistance because I do not have such assistance readily available, and the pop-up apparently disappears after a few seconds. The old Internet Explorer had a shortcut ALT-N to reach that bar or whatever it was so that a blind person could enter a response. Firefox needs something like that function if it doesn't already exist so that we who are blind would have access to this type of pop-up equal that of sighted users.
creator: knobman

title: Upgrading Firefox on my Samsung Smart TV
content:
Hi I recently signed up for CBS All Access on my Samsung Smart TV. When I went to run a trailer for The Stand it said, 'Opps your browser doesn't support this video'. So I tried to download the latest on my TV (I've never done this before) and it keeps saying Your download was interrupted. But all is not lost. Then I click on the help...and it still keeps doing it.

What am I doing wrong?

Thanks for your help in advance!

Kea Simental

title: Firefox downloads not starting
content:
On one of my machines, on my Firefox always updated to latest release, I have a weird behavior on downloads.

When I click on a download link, the download looks like starting in developers tools, but never ends. Anything is OK if I right-click and select "Save destination as...".

This happens in two different profiles.

I already tried Safe Mode (and it works as expected there), manually disabling the extensions and Hardware Acceleration and Avast! antivirus, but nothing changes. Any idea? Thanks in advance! Massi
creator: massic80b
